Methods

compute_clusters(data, app_data[, max_clusters])

Computes cluster results
compute_clusters(data, app_data, max_clusters=None)[source]#

Computes cluster results

When clustering is run once with a specified value of app_data.n_clusters, compute_cluster is run with max_cluster = None. Else clustering is run n_cluster fro 1 to app_data.max_clusters

class common.DataAnalysis.ClusteringUI(parent)[source]#

Bases: Clustering

Manages the clustering interface and links app_data updates to the MainWindow UI.

The ClusteringUI class connects UI elements in the application’s “Clustering” tab to corresponding app_data-handling logic. It listens for changes in style, and applies those settings to the active dataset.

The class also ensures that the UI is updated dynamically when the underlying data model changes, and that scheduled plot updates are triggered when required.

compute_clusters(data, app_data, max_clusters=None)#

Computes cluster results

When clustering is run once with a specified value of app_data.n_clusters, compute_cluster is run with max_cluster = None. Else clustering is run n_cluster fro 1 to app_data.max_clusters
